name: cabbage white production | cabbage white | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20945/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of fresh White Cabbage during November, 2016- March, 2017 at a farm located in village Makhmalabad, District Nashik of Maharashtra. In this area, fields are irrigated with ground water using micro irrigation for surface irrigation. The farm has a yield of 55,000 kg fresh matter per ha for this crop cycle. Sowing date for the crop is 04-January, 2017 and harvesting date is 03-March, 2017. Mineral NPK fertilizer input is 6.3-68.70-52.5 kg/ha. Micro/macro nutrients applied are Zinc 0.08 kg/ha, Borax 0.12 kg/ha, Manganese sulfate 0.08 kg/ha, and sulfite 0.08 kg/ha.  Organic fertilizer applied amounts to 25,000 kg of homemade compost. Only insecticide used has active ingredient as Chlorantranilipore 149.6g/ha, Dimethoate 1530g/ha, Emamectin Benzoate 42.5g/ha. Machinery is used for plant cultivation with fuel consumption of 4.99 kg/ha for pesticide spray and for Soil cultivation with fuel consumption of 9.98 kg/ha for soil tillage, plough and rotary cultivator.

This activity starts about four weeks after the harvest of the previous crop. The soil is prepared for cultivation in November and sowing of seeds started about five weeks after soil preparation. Thereafter the crop is mature for harvesting in about 2 months.

The activity ends with the harvesting of the mature White Cabbage from the plant
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0113:Growing of vegetables and melons, roots and tubers

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Soil cultivating date for the main crop: 30-November, 2016; Harvesting date main crop: 03-March, 2017. The soil cultivation, sowing and harvesting dates are taken as the middle date of the week or fortnight told to the data collector by the farmer. Total time from date of sowing to date of harvesting comes to 62 days.  The data is collected for one crop cycle. The cycle of one year is considered for entry in ecoeditor.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: village Makhmalabad, District Nashik of Maharashtra
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Cultivation of White Cabbage follows conventional production standards
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production was used to calculate field emissions from the cultivation process
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The farmer was identified and contacted by agriculture science faculty through agriculture consultant familiar with the local farmers in the region. Data was collected directly from the farmer through semi-structured interview using a questionnaire based on the input requirements of the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production. The farmer has provided the data from recent memory and the same is supplemented with information collected from farming community of the area.

exchanges.description: Calculated Value. This value has been calculated by using the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production.

Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'cabbage white' is calculated to be circa 2.32E-03 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate rock, as P2O5, beneficiated, dry', 'potassium chloride, as K2O', 'potassium sulfate, as K2O'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 4.64E-03 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.
